intro: Montanoa myriocephala, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, bright orange or red composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinct, slightly serrated edge, while its stems are upright and can reach heights of up to 3 meters. Montanoa myriocephala is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
